alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are aryl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Diarylethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a furanone.
alternative_parents.name: Benzofuranones

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds containing an isobenzofuran moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Isobenzofurans

alternative_parents.description: Salts or analogous metal derivatives of phenols.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl bromide functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl bromides

alternative_parents.description: Cyclic esters of hydroxy carboxylic acids, containing a 1-oxacycloalkan-2-one structure, or analogues having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring.
alternative_parents.name: Lactones

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives in which the carbon atom from the carbonyl group is attached to an alkyl or an aryl moiety through an oxygen atom (forming an ester group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing metals and halogens. Some are ionic while others are covalently bonded.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metal halides

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organobromides

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts containing a lead ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic lead salts

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a pyran ring. Pyran a six-membered heterocyclic, non-aromatic ring, made up of five carbon atoms and one oxygen atom and containing two double bonds.
class.name: Benzopyrans

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as xanthenes. These are polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a xanthene moiety, which consists of two benzene rings joined to each other by a pyran ring.

direct_parent.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a xanthene moiety, which consists of two benzene rings joined to each other by a pyran ring.
direct_parent.name: Xanthenes

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic heterocyclic compounds with a structure containing a dibenzopyran moiety, made up of two benzene rings fused to a central pyran ring.
intermediate_nodes.name: Dibenzopyrans

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic aromatic compounds that 1-benzopyran, a bicyclic compound made up of a benzene ring fused to a pyran, so that the oxygen atom is at the 1-position.
subclass.name: 1-benzopyrans

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
